attributes.action: Release non-violent prisoners serving under 4 years amidst the Corona outbreak
attributes.additional_details: If would be a devastation if such a virus went virulent in prisons. The already burdened NHS would be outstretched beyond its capabilities. A release of some 160,000 non-violent offenders would substantially ease the Health Service’s capacity and more importantly, a prisoners life and well being. On release, prisoners would abide by a strict curfew, electronically tagged. Such arrangements are already in place for prisoners nearing the end of their sentences. Let prisoners self isolate at home.
attributes.background: The Government must seriously set about the release of those prisoners who are serving sentences under 4 years for non-violent crimes amidst the ongoing outbreak of the Corona-virus. The deadly virus has spread sporadically across the UK and has recently been detected in multiple HMP establishments.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305604

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
